com.navis.framework.persistence.hibernate

Class PersistenceTemplate<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.persistence.hibernate.PersistenceTemplate<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the result type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PersistenceTemplatePropagationRequired, PersistenceTemplateSessionProhibited

    public class PersistenceTemplate<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Adds session/transaction/message collector to a method via CarinaPersistenceCallback Do not use the HibernateTemplate as the Hibernate session APIs are not directly available. Anything run inside CarinaPersistenceCallback.doInTransaction is conducted in SEPARATE session, transaction, and message collector. The primary usage for this is in batch uploads and other places where it's awkward to use other persistence patterns.

    WARNING: If you are inside a preexisting transaction, please be warned this isn't a true PROPAGATION_REQUIRES_NEW. This is because we are still sharing the same underlying connection so the commit of the inner PersistenceTemplate will commit any pending changes on the jdbc connection.

      Constructors

      • setRollbackOnSevereErrors

        public void setRollbackOnSevereErrors(boolean inFlag)
        Use to override making a rollback if there are severe errors thrown or in the MessageCollector. This API only overrides for errors in the MessageCollector and NOT for errors thrown.
        Parameters:
        inFlag - send in false to override any severe errors in MessageCollector and still attemt commit.

      • isRollbackOnSevereErrors

        public boolean isRollbackOnSevereErrors()
        Returns the flag that controls, if an error in the message collector during transaction should rollback.
        Returns:
        the flag controlling, if rollback should happen on severe errors

public MessageCollector invoke(CarinaPersistenceCallback<T> inCallback)

        Returns:

        protected void checkInnerTemplate()

      • invokeRunnable

        @NotNull
public PersistenceTemplate<T> invokeRunnable(CheckedRunnable inCheckedRunnable)
        Sets up session and transaction, executes callback and handles rollback. It wraps any caught exception in a BizFailure. This function should be used if the callback does not need to return a result.
        Parameters:
        inCheckedRunnable - the callback to be executed
        Returns:
        the persistence template

      • invokeCallable

        @NotNull
public PersistenceTemplate<T> invokeCallable(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> inCallable)
        Sets up session and transaction, executes callback and handles rollback. It wraps any caught exception in a BizFailure. This function should be used if the callback needs to return a result.
        Parameters:
        inCallable - the callback to be executed
        Returns:
        the persistence template

        public MessageCollector getMessageCollector()

        Returns:
        the message collector

        public boolean hasError()
        Returns if the persistence template has an error
        Returns:

        public PersistenceTemplate<T> throwIfError()

        Returns:
        the persistence template

      • preprocessThrownError

        protected java.lang.Throwable preprocessThrownError(@NotNull
                                                    java.lang.Throwable inT)
        Override this method if you want a more specific error for anything which is thrown an not applied to the thread. Note you must still handle SevereErrorsInResponseException
        Parameters:
        inT - error which was thrown by the callback, can be usermessage or unexpected failure
        Returns:
        the error that should processed

      • getResult

        public T getResult()
        Gets the optional result which has been set by the callback (otherwise null). Depending on the logic in the callback, callers should check whether an error occurred (or whether the result has actually been set) before calling this method. This method has no other side-effects and does not throw an exception.
        Returns:
        result of the callback (if set by the callback)

      • hasResult

        public boolean hasResult()
        Returns true if the result has been set by the callback.
        Returns:
        true if the result has been set by the callback.

        Parameters:

      • isThrowOnError

        protected boolean isThrowOnError()
        Returns true if throwIfError() is called before invoke()
        Returns:
        true or false
